page.title: 15Woodlands
page.content: Woodlands exist on steep, thin or wet land. Largest are Smithy Moor and Birches (GRSW corner 409311.) The Birches is mainly mature narrow leaved species. Yarnest and Lee Woods )GR 411321) formerly Heron Nest Plantation(1839) have been extended over steep, poor, glacial soil. The Scots Pines are on sand, others on gravel. Narrow (eg Larch) and broad leaved (eg Birch) occur. The undulating land has at least one wet area supporting Willows. Tracing of coppicing remain. GR 407309-Scots Pine dominant. GR 423324-narrow leaved plantation as part of land reclamation. GR 418328-at least 150 years old with Oak dominant on the slopes with Beech near the Mere, interspersed with ornamental trees. Other woodlands occur at 406328, 412328, 415325.
